newsitem.title: USA: USDA corrects adjusted world cotton price.
newsitem.headline: USDA corrects adjusted world cotton price.

text.p: The U.S. Agriculture Department corrected itself Friday and said the latest prevailing world price for upland cotton is 66.57 cents per lb, not 66.53 cents as it announced Thursday.
The error stemmed from the "transportation adjustment" used to calculate the weekly world cotton price.
In Thursday's announcement, that factor was incorrectly listed as 12.23 cents a lb. It should have been 12.19 cents, USDA said.
